quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Number and Ncaa
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What number did the Babe wear for the New York Yankees?
In both the NBA and the NCAA you can choose any number you want for your jersey.
Both college and professional basketball have four quarters.
NBA and NCAA have the same number of players lined up along the lane while a free throw is being attempted.
What year was Babe Ruth born?
The number of timeouts for non-televised and televised college basketball games is the same.
When there is a held ball between two players, there is no jump ball in NCAA basketball.
There is no overtime period in NCAA basketball.
NBA and NCAA regulation courts are the same size.
Babe Ruth died in 1948.
What was the name of Babe Ruths second wife?
The 8-second rule exists in both NBA and NCAA hoops.
Babe Ruth batted from the left side in the batters box.
How many major league baseball teams did Babe Ruth play for?
Babe Ruths birth name was George Henry Ruth.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: League and Major League Baseball
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, charm, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many home runs did the Babe hit while playing major league baseball?
In which sport would you find Bay Matuka, Blue Charm, Green Highlander, Silver Stoat, and Logie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salmon Fishing

questions.question: It is generally accepted that the phrase red herring, which has been in popular parlance for many years, is derived from which sport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fox hunting

questions.question: A pair of comedians neither of whom played pro baseball are enshrined in the Baseball Hall of Fame because of one of their routines.
Who has the highest ranking in an NFL game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Referee

questions.question: Which statement about athlete Danuta Rosani is true?

options.text: She was the first Italian female athlete to win an Olympic gold medal.
She was the first female athlete found to be technically a male.
She was the first Russian athlete to escape to the USA.
She was the first athlete in the track and field events to be disqualified in the Olympics for a banned  substance.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was the first athlete in the track and field events to be disqualified in the Olympics for a banned  substance.

questions.question: The Cleveland Tigers, the Muncie Flyers, the Hammond Pros, and the Dayton Triangles were some of the original teams in which league?
Who were the first two losing teams in the Super Bowl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chiefs and Raiders

questions.question: The actor who played Oddjob in the Bond movie Goldfinger won an Olympic Medal. Which statement is true about him?

options.text: His name was Toshiyuki Harold Sakata.
He won an Olympic Gold Medal in karate in the 1960 Olympics.
He won an Olympic Gold Medal in weightlifting  in the 1956 Olympics.
He was born in Japan and died in Los Angeles, California.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His name was Toshiyuki Harold Sakata.

questions.question: What trophy is awarded to the Super Bowl-winning team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vince Lombardi Trophy

questions.question: What quarter back led in passing yards in 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rich Gannon

questions.question: The Babe played his first game in major league baseball in 1914.
Which Baseball Hall of Famer is credited with throwing the first curveball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Arthur Cummings

questions.question: With what team did Babe Ruth finish his major league baseball playing career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston Braves

questions.question: What distinction does Masanori Murakami hold?

options.text: The first player to steal a base in the Olympics.
The first player to hit a home run in an international competition.
The first Japanese-born major league baseball player.
The first player to hit a home run in the Olympics.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first Japanese-born major league baseball player.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Muhammad Ali and Season
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, suns, ace. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Suns traded Shaun Marion and a package of prospects to the struggling Miami Heat for Shaquille ONeal.
In what city and year did Muhammad Ali win the Olympic gold medal for the United States of America in the boxing light heavyweight division?
Who had the most touchdown passes in a season before Payton Manning set a new record?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Marino

questions.question: Which of these NFL players played the most career games?

options.text: They played the same number of games.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Blanda

questions.question: Who was the first NFL kicker to finish the regular season with a 100% success rate on field goals and extra points?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Anderson

questions.question: Who had the most home runs in the 2007 Major League Baseball season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alex Rodriguez

questions.question: The Boston Celtics of 2007-2008 started out with the best start in Boston Celtic franchise history.
Who was drafted by the Cleveland Browns first overall in the 2000 NFL draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Courtney Brown

questions.question: In 2007, the Minnesota Twins traded their ace Johan Santana to the Red Soxs for third baseman Mike Lowell.
What uniform number did Walter Payton wear when he played for the Bears?
What was the score of the 2008 Super Bowl?
Name the first team to both play in and lose four Super Bowls.
The Red Sox swept the Colorado Rockies in the 2007 World Series.
Muhammad Ali took up boxing as a result of someone stealing his bicycle.
What team did Tony Dorsett play for after he left the Cowboys?

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Muhammad Ali and Fight
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, defeat, bronze. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During a fight, Muhammad Ali kept asking this boxer, What is my name?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernie Terrell

questions.question: Joe Frazier defeated Muhammad Ali in the first of their 3 fights.
Who was Muhammad Alis last opponent before his boxing license was suspended in 1967?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zora Folley

questions.question: Did Muhammad Ali get his jaw broken in a fight against Ken Norton in 1973?
Who did Muhammad Ali fight against in his come-back match in 1970?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Quarry

questions.question: Although Muhammad Ali was from Louisville, Kentucky he represented this major American city as a junior in the Golden Gloves.
In 1978, Muhammad Ali lost to this boxer but then defeated him later that year, thus regaining the heavyweight championship title for a record 3rd time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leon Spinks

questions.question: Who won the fight referred to as The Thrilla in Manila?

options.text: Ali won by a technical knock out after 14 rounds.
Ali knocked out Frazier after 14 rounds.
Ali knocked out Frazier in the final round.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ali won by a technical knock out after 14 rounds.

questions.question: What name was given to the tactic that Muhammad Ali used to defeat George Foreman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rope a Dope

questions.question: On his way to fighting George Foreman, Muhammad Ali lost a fight against this boxer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ken Norton

questions.question: Who was Muhammad Alis first professional fight and victory against?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tunney Hunsacker

questions.question: In which African country did Muhammad Ali fight George Foreman in a match referred to as The Rumble in the Jungle?
When did Muhammad Ali defeat Sonny Liston to win the World Heavyweight Championship?
At the 1988 Olympics, this lady earned a bronze medal, thus becoming the first African-American to win an Olympic medal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debi Thomas

questions.question: Which one of his boxing opponents did Muhammad Ali label The Washer Woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Chuvalo

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nfl and Lady
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these ladies has 10 Figure Skating World Championship Gold Medals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonja Hennie

questions.question: In 1936, the NFL instituted the first ever draft of college players. Who was the first player ever drafted into the NFL?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jay Berwanger

questions.question: The Detroit Lions entered the NFL in 1929 as the Detroit Lions.
In 1994 in Lilihammer, this lady became the first Chinese skater to win a medal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lu Chen

questions.question: The first Ladies Figure Skating World Champion was crowned in this year.
In 1989, the Figure Skating World Championships had a new nation as a contender for possible glory. Who was the first Japanese female skater to win the World Championships?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midori Ito

questions.question: In 1999, the reigning World Champion Michelle Kwan lost to a Russian who became the first woman from her country to win a Figure Skating World Championship. Who is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria Butyrskaya

questions.question: Art Shell of the Oakland Raiders was the first African American head coach in the NFL.
At the 1992 Olympics in Albertville, this figure skater became the first Asian-American to medal at the Winter Olympics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kristi Yamaguchi

questions.question: Who was the first lady to perform a successful triple Axel in a figure skating competition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midori Ito

questions.question: Who was the first lady to win the Figure Skating World Championships?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madge Syers-Cave

questions.question: The NFL started out as the Ohio League.
In 2005, Michelle Kwan won her 9th US title, tying the record set by what other American female skater?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maribel Vinson Owen

questions.question: Two of the founding members of the NFL are in existence today. What are their original names?

options.text: Racine Cardinals and Green Bay Packers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Decatur Staleys and Racine Cardinals

questions.question: This Japanese dynamo became the first lady to land a quadruple jump in competition. It was a junior competition, but it still counts as a figure skating first.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miki Ando

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Bob Gibson and Athletes
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, country, athletes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of pitcher was Bob Gibson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Starting righthander

questions.question: As Bob Gibson was primarily a relief pitcher, he has not been voted into the Major League Baseball Hall of Fame.
What was Bob Gibsons primary uniform number?
What university did Bob Gibson attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Creighton University

questions.question: In 1960 after being refused entry into the NFL as an owner, Lamar Hunt formed the rival AFL.
There was a team in the NFL named the Carpets.
How many Cy Young Awards did Bob Gibson win?
What year was the NFL Players Association formed?
Which country was represented by the highest number of athletes at the Olympic Games of 2008?
Athletes representing which discipline were the first to compete during the 2008 Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Football / Soccer

questions.question: Michael Phelps (USA, swimming) declared he would set a record by winning 8 gold medals at the Olympic Games in Beijing. How many did he actually win?
Who became the fastest man by setting a world record of 9.69s at the 2008 Olympics 100m run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Usain Bolt (Jamaica)

questions.question: Bob Gibson was the second pitcher to strikeout 3,000 batters. Who was the first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Johnson

questions.question: How many times did Bob Gibson win a Golden Glove Award?
What is the only Major League Baseball team Bob Gibson played for?
